caption: Wonderful Valentines  meal at home. Delicious tastes and superb wonderful dinner. We felt like we were in Italy on a chilly Maine winter night. The fresh pasta  flavors and herbs melded together so beautifuly. We loved all 3 dishes eggplant rollatini    Ravioli  Bolognese  and  fettuccine Alfredo with a beautiful focaccia bread to complement our meal. The Caesar salad to start the meal was perfect. We are looking forward to the tiramisu ,the end to our perfect night in! Kudos to Chef Kevin And his team . 6 stars !!!!
Great food and great staff!

EXPENSIVE OLIVE GARDEN. I think thats the simplest way to put it. Server was really nice but food is simply DISGUSTING. I've been to 🇮🇹  many times, and Luigi wouldn't chew this. Please pick somewhere else
Never fails to be a good meal. I'm pretty sure the menu changes occasionally.
Nice selection of food and wine, quiet, friendly staff. Delicious.

Went there with friends and the meal was average and service was also average. What was a game changer was when they started to clean the kitchen before we had finished our meal. The odor was awful and possibly dangerous. Will never be back there. Unacceptable.
Really good food. We loved the cozy environment  The waiter was exceptional.  I highly recommend trying Ribolita.  Portland has an amazing foodie scene overall.
Fabulous Little Italian place on Portland waterfront. Phenomenal food.
The food was good, but the service was extraordinarily slow and the staff seem very disinterested in the customer experience.
amazing!!!

Attentive and knowledgeable service from server Jim. Especially impressed with his ability to select a wine for my non-wine-loving friend. We ordered 6 dishes and they were each flawlessly executed! One of the dishes was a risotto made fresh from start to finish with perfect texture and consistency - very impressive and unusual that a chef devotes this amount of effort and time during service. The kicker? Not very expensive relative to the quality and quantity of food. Very well done in the top tier category of Portland fine dining.
Nice traditional trattoria feel and delicious seasonal specials.
Good food I like it

Came to Portland for our 33rd anniversary, came to Ribollita just from reviews. What an awesome place, had the Northern linguine with white sauce, which was fantastic. No sand grit in seafood. The wife had the short rib which she loved, and she is a very picky eater. Wish we could fit dessert. Enjoyed it immensely.
Some of the best homemade pasta I have eaten anywhere! They know how to make it and more importantly they know how to cook it! No dissapointments here!
A lovely anniversary dinner. Wish we'd had room for dessert. Compliments to the chef!
Such a disappointment. I feel like our server really let us down. She had little to tell us about the dishes and knew less about the wine.

My wife, son and I went there to enjoy a meal and celebrate a birthday. The service was excellent but the meals were definitely not up to standard. My son had a beef special that had so much fat and gristle that he had to dismantle it to find the meat, I had what they called North End Linguine with scallops that was loaded with garlic and soupy, definitely not what was expected. This was our second meal there and were looking forward to a good experience. Didn’t happen and probably won’t return.
Food was excellent!
Wonderful food a great service. Very attentive and friendly. Food is cooked to perfection. If you are interested in an authentic Italian meal this is the place to go!
Love this place! We've  eaten here 3, or 4 times and love it. One feels pampered, but not pestered. Professional staff. (Jim on weekends). Food is thoughtfully created.
Great service and delicious food!
Not much good for gluten free - I had Risotto - but very good food, and lovely ambience. Book in advance.
Excellent food with pleasant service, not to fancy, not to casual, just right!
Very good risotto, and very good service. What more could you want?

Fairly small menu, but anything with fresh, handmade pasta gets a recommendation from me! Ravioli was unique and exciting, a rare find. The menu is fairly small, but if you're in the mood for fresh Italian classics, you don't need a big menu. Atmosphere was a bit lacking, but that could have just been the day. Looking forward to visiting again to try more of the menu!

This is a place you spend a couple of hours dining. If you want in and out dining go somewhere else. The bad reviews are really perplexing but even good restaurants get it wrong once in awhile. I had a ravioli special and she had the short ribs and both were excellent. We also had one app, one desert and a house liter of wine for under $100.
yum
Service and quality of food was excellent. We had a great time there.

Ok...how did this place ever get such good ratings??? Went there and had dinner..It felt like that a can of spaghetti sauce was poured over a frozen bag of seafood.... The sad part was... service was really nice while food was just terrible. We had the worst dinner and paid over $80 for it. That was an insult to ingredients.

Food was adequate... unfortunately, I think that we were definitely fooled by the high rating.  The wait staff was good but the food left something to be desired. There seems to be other good options in the area, go there instead.
Really amazing Italian food, make sure to make a reservation or get there early, it's a small restaurant but so worth the wait!

The food was amazing, the service was very cordial and best part is there was no wait when we went. We were tired of waiting nearby restaurant so went here and it was very very fulfilling. We had the eggplant and salmon florentine and it was very well done. Very Tasty !!

Ribolita has amazing service and has the greatest pasta in downtown Portlandia. The chef is great but his fantasy football team is subpar.  Hoping to wash the dishes there next summer, so if your seeing this Mr. Quiet feel free to contact me.

This place right in downtown Portland, puts all the foodie places in Portland to shame. I come here get some sort of pasta and eat it in one bite, it's like crack. If you haven't come here you aren't a foodie.

Shout out K. Quiet bomb of a chef. Can't go wrong with the classics. I've been going to this place for over 6 years, and I just bought a computer to write this review. Love the chef love the venue, love the hustle. Everyone must go here.

Most likely/ definitely the best meal I had on our 6 day trip from Portland to Bar Harbor and may we add the cheapest!! ( had $60 fast food seafarer the night before...in Bass Harbor). Perfect execution of Gnocchi, waitress was knowledgeable and service speedy! I would definitely be back if I lived here
impeccable food and service! I cant wait to back

Food was good but nothing impressive.  The carmelized onion tart appetizer was better than our entrees.  The waitress was new and seemed really overwhelmed - didn't tell us any of the specials, forgot to bring bread, waited over 20 minutes for a salad...many tables came and went while we waited for our food.  The prices are ok but the portion sizes are a bit small.
Excellent food & service - very reasonably priced for the quality .
Ristoante Classico!   Intimate, quiet , and authentically delicioso! Great service too!
Very quaint restaurant. Excellent food. Worth the walk from downtown.

Very reasonable prices for quality Italian cuisine in the Greater Portland area. Relaxing, cozy atmosphere, prompt service and food delivery, amazing flavors--everything was wonderful! Don't make the mistake of skipping the homemade desserts, either. The tiramisu was out of this world. We will definitely be back!
Excellent
Excellent service.  Cozy, intimate atmosphere that lends itself to long conversations. Food that is carefully prepared and happily eaten. Enjoyable on so many levels.
Good..i like to this store...
Portion sizes are just right that you are left wanting a little more. Quality of food is top notch. Love the dim lighted, soft atmosphere. Extremely relaxing.
Fantastic Quality, Fair Price

Ribollita’s is tucked in between a couple of restaurants at the tail end of Middle Street on the outskirts of the Old Port. This place is most definitely worth seeking out for Italian fare!  This is not a large restaurant by any stretch and while the tables for 2 are packed quite closely together, it still has an intimate feeling to the ambiance.  The food is delicious… My girlfriend had the short ribs and I had the chicken puttanesca, both were quite generous potions. The mussels and the Bellini cocktails were fabulous as was the outstanding service that we received from the staff.  This menu may just be the best value in the Old Port. Large portions for a below average price with the highest quality of ingredients...great combination in my humble opinion!  Definitely a must go to place if your looking for a romantic authentic Italian dinner on a budget!

I'm a culinary student, I was told by a professor to try risotto at this restaurant if I had a chance. I did and flavor was definitely present. Except, someone who cleaned tomatoes forgot to cut out stems. I also had Tortellini soup, that was suppose to be in a rich chicken broth. Unfortunately broth did not live up to how it is described on a menu. Chef had physically ran into me on the way to a storage room, without any regard, he continued on. Yet, he could not stop entertaining the tables where a folks who looked like they drive an E-class were dinning. I've checked out reviews after I left, apparently I'm not the only one who had this kind of experience.
Amazing
It was very good and tasty much approve
(Translated by Google) Starter  (Original) Antipasto
Excellent food and wine. Not the place to go if you are in a hurry.
Accessible, delicious Italian food conveniently located. I cannot commend the service enough. Our waiter was charming, friendly, and patient, and made my evening both enjoyable and memorable.
We enjoyed our meal though it wasn't amazing. The ravioli was really good. The risotto special was a bit odd and didn't really seem like risotto. Pomodoro was very good.
Love this place. Ample servings of simply awesome Italian fare with local flavor. Service and atmosphere are equally delicious. Fair prices top it off!
Small place with a big heart.  Food is as good or better than Boston’s North End.  Staff was awesome.  Never thought I would see something this good in Portland.   Will be back.

I got take out so my review is based on that. The food was quite (actually very) good, sauce had plenty of flavor and the portion size was more than enough. Prices are slightly higher than they are on the website but still well worth the money. Also the resturant is very cute if you decide to eat there.
Lovely staff, excellent food ,not overgarnished with garlic as most are in Portland maine.  .Highly recommended. Peaceful dining experience. Thank you for your dining acumen.

Really nice staff, lovely atmosphere perfect for a first time date :) The food was really good! However, I do wish the portions were a little bigger in size. The prices were reasonable for a small restaurant like this, especially when it is only open during dinner hours.
Awesome atmosphere, terrific  food, reasonable prices and the most important part - Great Wine selection

I'll start with the positives. Service was great, food was great although needed a bit of salt. Prosciutto and melon... perfectly fresh, sweet, tender melon and nice prosciutto even if it was a bit too thin. I could eat that dish all day. Bf got braised pork with pasta and beans and greens etc. And was very happy with it. I tried it and also thought it was delicious, though the pasta cuts were a little beyond rustic and ranged from fettuccine to almost a ravioli sheet, with some pappardelle in between. I got tortellini in brodo. Considering it was only $6 I wasn't expecting a ton, and was surprised by a large bowl. Pretty much just tasted like parsley it was garnished with so much of it. And there were four large, obviously homemade tortellini. Always love handmade pasta. Issue was that they were so big you had to cut into them but the filling was just straight cheese, I assume, because immediately after cutting into it it all dissolved into the broth and left be with wet empty pasta. Also one of the four arrived exploded which was a shame but after eating the others and losing the filling I guess it didn't make much difference. This was all acceptable, and totally fine. Whatever. The main issue was that we arrived around 5:45 to a half empty restaurant. Took about half an hour for our appetizer (slices of melon wrapped in prosciutto) and then about an hour after we had finished that for the entrees. Didn't realize they were braising the pork to order.... Lol. Wanted dessert because it looked great but didn't order it because we didn't want to wait another hour. Literally almost asked the waitress for the bread back. I get that it takes longer when you cook everything to order and make quality good, and especially when you only have two cooks, but come on, if you have less than ten tables to serve it should never take as long as it took last night, it was absurd. The food was great but I would honestly not go back because the wait was so ridiculous. And I don't mind waiting for good food we weren't in a rush but damn, get it together...

I had ravioli....soooo good, light and tasty and perfect portion...would certainly repeat it was so delicious.  Hubby had scallops in sauce which was also very tasty.  Service was great and look forward to returning. Reservations a must...

I had  white fish in brothy saffron sauce that was bland. My wife had a pork dish with white beans and pasta that was greasy but decent. Overall not bad food, just lacking the depth we had found at other restaurants in Portland.

I just had their scallops in a white sauce - I look forward my return visit - it will be difficult to order something different. Like many Portland restaurants it is a small place so reservations are a must - great service and a nice varied menu.  My wife had the scallops in the white wine sauce and she enjoyed it, as did I, while finishing her meal. Serving sizes are ample - prices are typical for Portland's fine dining restaurants. A great Italian restaurant to add to your list of regulars - parking is difficult.
The homemade bean ravioli is the best. The pasta is very tender and the sauce is rich and flavorful. It's the best ravioli I've ever had. Can't wait to go back to Maine to have it.
Would like more flavor to sauce . Service very good

We frequently, for us, dine there, one of our favorites.  There are always imaginative dishes in addition to the very good main menu.  One of the more imaginative plates is the antipasto starter, which is always different, always interesting, always appetizing.  The wines are, like the menu itself, reasonably priced and of good variety.  One of our top two in a city that has many excellent restaurants.
visited with my family and we all enjoyed our meals. the chicken saltimbocca was excellent as well
Amazing atmosphere, fantastic food, superb service! We will be back time and time again.

My experience was not about food. As we are about to sit down, I remove my blazer and hang it on the back of the chair. The latter did not bear that light blazer. So the chair flips backward as i was about to sit.. and you can imagine the rest.. But what shocked me the most was when the waitress comes up to apologize and says" We are sorry, our chairs are so light-weighted they cannot support anything on them, and it happened to previous customers as well". You may want to keep that in mind next time you go!

Food was good but did not live up to expectations based on price.  The chef is a bit too fancy interpreting food from this region.  Tuscan food should have the fewest number of (great) ingredients possible.  For instance, my wife's ravioli was overpowered by the balsamic reduction - why mask the main part of the dish?!  My stuffed eggplant was a bit tasteless with lack-luster eggplant and cheese but tasty red sauce.  Apps (Caprese salad,  mussels) were excellent.  Once again, there was too much going on with the maple cheesecake with raspberry/balsamic(?) reduction dessert.  Service was excellent.
